description:
Geo fields can carry data about a specific location related to an event. This geolocation information can be derived from techniques such as Geo IP, or be user-supplied.
Note: Geo attributes are typically used under another namespace, such as client.* and describe the location of the corresponding entity (device, end-user, etc). Semantic conventions that reference geo attributes (as a root namespace) or embed them (under their own namespace) SHOULD document what geo attributes describe in the scope of that convention.

geo.locality.name.description: Locality name. Represents the name of a city, town, village, or similar populated place.

geo.location.lon.description: Longitude of the geo location in [WGS84](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System#WGS84).

geo.location.lat.description: Latitude of the geo location in [WGS84](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System#WGS84).

geo.postal_code.description: Postal code associated with the location. Values appropriate for this field may also be known as a postcode or ZIP code and will vary widely from country to country.
